SEARCH
Package com.clientui.clientui.controller

Class ClientController

java.lang.Object
com.clientui.clientui.controller.ClientController
@Controller public class ClientController extends Object
Controller class for handling client-side requests in the MicroDiab application. This class manages the interaction between the frontend (Thymeleaf templates) and the backend microservices. It provides endpoints for displaying patient lists, updating patient information, adding new patients, and managing patient notes. It also integrates with Spring Security for user authentication and role management.

This controller uses Feign clients to communicate with other microservices (e.g., mPatient, mNotes, mRisk) and leverages Spring's tracing capabilities for monitoring and debugging purposes.

See Also:
  • PatientBean
  • NoteBean
  • RiskLevelBean
  • MicroservicesProxy

  • Method Details

    • addUserInfoToModel

      @ModelAttribute public void addUserInfoToModel(@RequestHeader(value="X-Auth-Username",required=false,defaultValue="None_Username") String username, @RequestHeader(value="X-Auth-Roles",required=false,defaultValue="None_Role") String roles, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Adds user information (username and roles) to the model for every request. This method is automatically invoked by Spring MVC before any handler method is called.
      Parameters:
      username - The username extracted from the request header.
      roles - The roles extracted from the request header.
      model - The model to which user information is added.

    • showHomes

      @RequestMapping("/home") public String showHomes(@RequestHeader(value="X-Auth-Username",required=false,defaultValue="None_Username") String username, @RequestHeader(value="X-Auth-Roles",required=false,defaultValue="None_Username") String roles, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Displays the home page of the application.
      Parameters:
      username - The username extracted from the request header.
      roles - The roles extracted from the request header.
      model - The model to which attributes are added.
      Returns:
      The name of the Thymeleaf template for the home page.

    • showPatients

      @RequestMapping("/patients") public String showPatients(org.springframework.ui.Model model, @RequestParam(required=false) String error)
      Displays the list of patients.
      Parameters:
      model - The model to which attributes are added.
      error - An optional error message to display.
      Returns:
      The name of the Thymeleaf template for the patient list page.

    • showUpdateForm

      @RequestMapping("/update/{id}") public String showUpdateForm(@PathVariable("id") Long id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Displays the form for updating a patient's information.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the patient to update.
      model - The model to which attributes are added.
      Returns:
      The name of the Thymeleaf template for the update form.

    • addNote

      @PostMapping("/update/{id}/addnotes") public String addNote(@PathVariable("id") Long id, @ModelAttribute("newNote") NoteBean newNote, org.springframework.ui.Model model, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
      Adds a new note for a specific patient and updates the view accordingly.

      This method retrieves the patient by ID, associates the new note with the patient, and persists the note via the services proxy. It also sets the patient and note as request attributes for further processing in the view layer.

      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the patient.
      newNote - The note to be added, wrapped in a NoteBean.
      model - The model to which attributes can be added (not used in this method).
      request - The HTTP request, used to set attributes for the view.
      redirectAttributes - Attributes for redirecting with flash messages (success/error).
      Returns:
      A redirect to the patient update page, including the patient ID in the path.
      Throws:
      feign.FeignException - If the patient is not found or the note cannot be added.

      Displays the form for adding a new patient.
      Parameters:
      model - The model to which attributes are added.
      Returns:

    • addPatient

      @PostMapping("/add/addPatient") public String addPatient(@ModelAttribute("patient") PatientBean patient, org.springframework.ui.Model model, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
      Processes the submission of the add patient form.
      Parameters:
      patient - The patient to add.
      model - The model to which attributes are added.
      request - The HTTP request.
      redirectAttributes - Attributes for redirecting with flash messages.
      Returns:
      A redirect to the patient list page.

    • updatePatient

      @PostMapping("/update/{id}/updatepatient") public String updatePatient(@PathVariable("id") Long id, @ModelAttribute("patient") PatientBean patient, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)

      Parameters:

      request - The HTTP request.
      redirectAttributes - Attributes for redirecting with flash messages.
      Returns:
      A redirect to the patient update page.
